required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Postoperative Pain of Rotary Versus Reciprocating Motions of Two Single Files
clinical_study.official_title: Postoperative Pain After Pulpectomy of Primary Molars Using With Rotary Versus Reciprocation Motions of Two Single Files: A Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: An equivalent parallel randomized clinical trial was approved by the local University Committee of Ethics. 260 children with necrotic primary molars were allocated into 2 equal groups (82 children per group). The participants were allocated into two groups; group "1" teeth were instrumented with OneShape rotary system (Micro Mega, Besancon, France), and group "2" teeth were instrumented with WaveOne Gold reciprocating system (Dentsply Maillefer, Ballaigues, Switzerland). Postoperative pain was assessed using a four-point pain intensity rating scale adopted from Wong-Baker FACES (WBF) pain scale . The face scale consists of four faces with a brief title describing each face representing a scale from the first face (score 1), second face (score 2), third face (score 3), and forth face (score 4) 3. Postoperative pain was assessed at 6 six time intervals (at 6, 12, 24, 48, 72 hours and one-week).

primary_outcome.description: Postoperative pain was assessed using a four-point pain intensity rating scale adopted from Wong-Baker FACES (WBF) pain scale . The face scale consists of four faces with a brief title describing each face representing a scale from the first face (score 1), second face (score 2), third face (score 3), and fourth face (score 4) 17. Postoperative pain was assessed at 6 six time intervals

arm_group.arm_group_label: Rotary motion using OneShape single file
arm_group.description: File size 25 with a taper of 0.06 was mounted to a 6:1 speed-reduction headpiece powered by X Smart Plus endomotor (Dentsply Maillefer, Ballaigues, Switzerland). The speed and torque were set to 400 rpm and 1 N.cm torque, respectively. In a picking motion without pressure, mechanical preparation began with the first RC two-thirds followed by the next 3 mm followed by the full WL.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Reciprocating motion using WaveOne Gold single file
arm_group.description: A Primary file size 25 a taper of 0.07 was installed to pre-programmed reciprocation angles and speed for the WaveOne system handpiece of an endomotor (X Smart Plus endomotor (Dentsply Maillefer, Ballaigues, Switzerland). After ensuring a passive fit of the hand file along the predetermined WL, the RC coronal two-thirds was initially instrumented then followed by the full WL.

intervention.description: The rotary motion of OneShape single file
intervention.arm_group_label: Rotary motion using OneShape single file

intervention.description: reciprocation motions of WaveOne Gold single file
intervention.arm_group_label: Reciprocating motion using WaveOne Gold single file

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Children ages from 4 to 8 years classified as class I or II according to the American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA).
2. No previous dental experience.
3. Non-vital primary molar (necrotic or with chronic apical periodontitis) which confirmed radiographicly with the presence or absence of periapical radiolucency.
4. Severe tooth mobility.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Severe behaviour or emotional disabilities.
2. Analgesic intake in the preceding 12 hours.
3. Non-restorable crowns of primary molars.
4. Radiographic presence of internal root resorption or massive bone destruction.
5. Root resorption exceeded one-third of the root length.
-
